text.__SUMMARY__: Villiers's blind snake. (Rhinoleptus koniagui) is a snake found in West Africa. It is monotypic in the genus Rhinoleptus. It is among the smallest snakes in the world. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Geographic range: Found in West Africa in Senegal (Bonghari and Casamance) and Guinea (Kouroussa and Youkounkoun). The type locality given is "Guinée Francaise: Youkounkoun" (Guinea).
